channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: 'Seinfeld' might not be available to stream for months
item.description: 'Seinfeld' reportedly won't reach Netflix until September, leaving people without a streaming fix for months after the show leaves Hulu.

item.title: 'Atomically thin' transistors could help make electronic skins a reality
item.description: Stanford researchers have developed 'atomically-thin' flexible electronics that could make electronic skin (and new implants) practical.

item.title: iPhone bug 'breaks' your WiFi when you join an oddly-named network
item.description: Users have discovered an iPhone bug that 'breaks' WiFi if you connect to a hotspot with an unusual name.

item.title: Facial recognition systems are denying unemployment benefits across the US
item.description: A facial recognition system from ID.me is denying unemployment benefits to people across the US with potentially concerning frequency.

item.title: ICYMI: The new Studio Buds are the best Beats for most people
item.description: Engadget's tech reviews this week include the Beats Studio Buds, the ASUS ROG Strix G15 Advantage laptop and the Acer Chromebook Spin 713 laptop.

item.title: NASA struggles to fix a Hubble Space Telescope computer glitch
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope has been suffering from a payload computer glitch for nearly a week, and NASA hasn't had much success fixing it.

item.title: Hitting the Books: How memes spread through society like a 'mind virus'
item.description: In The Ascent of Information, award winning New York Times author Caleb Scharf explores humanity's unique penchant for maintaining stores of information outside of ourselves and the steps we'll soon have to take if we want to hang on to the 20 quintillion bits of data we produce every day.

item.title: These wireless earbuds are $65 for a limited time
item.description: Raycon E50 Wireless Bluetooth 5.0 Earbuds provide top-quality sound, a snug fit and are on sale right now.

item.title: California gives residents digital access to their COVID-19 vaccine record
item.description: The state of California has launched a tool designed to give residents easy access to a digital copy of their COVID-19 vaccine information.

item.title: Google may be adding Bluetooth detection to its Find My Device service
item.description: Google may be working on expanding Android’s Find My Device functionality to more closely match the capabilities of Apple’s Find My network.

item.title: EA tests FIFA Ultimate Team loot boxes you can preview
item.description: As part of FIFA 21’s ongoing Festival of FUTball event, EA is selling new Ultimate Team Preview Packs that allow you to see their contents before you make a decision whether to buy them.

item.title: Tool around in a real-time generated AI version of 'GTAV'
item.description: YouTuber Harrison Kinsley shared a video on GAN Theft Auto, an AI that can generate a playable stretch of Grand Theft Auto V’s gameworld on its own.

item.title: YouTube's iOS app is finally getting picture-in-picture
item.description: It'll be a Premium feature at first before rolling out to all users in the US.

item.title: Everything you missed at 2021's all-digital E3
item.description: The first online-only E3 officially ended Tuesday, but Summer Game Fest has just begun. Engadget editors take stock of what the major players got right.

item.title: Google's $99 Pixel Buds A-Series are now available
item.description: You can buy the Pixel Buds A-Series starting today on Google's website, as well as retailers like Best Buy and Walmart.

item.title: The second-gen iZotope Spire Studio is a big improvement at a big cost
item.description: If you liked the original Spire portable studio from iZotope, you'll love the second generation. But be warned, the solid upgrades come at a price.

item.title: This week's best deals: Get two Echo Dots for $50 ahead of Amazon Prime Day
item.description: Here are the week's best tech deals including early Amazon Prime Day 2021 deals on Echo Dots and the Echo Show 5, and the Beats Flex earbuds for $39.

item.title: Elon Musk's Boring Company is reportedly pitching freight tunnels
item.description: The Boring Company is shifting its attention to wider, freight-friendly tunnels after its early commuter passages got a frigid response.

item.title: Save 14 percent on this Bluetooth speaker from TREBLAB
item.description: The TREBLAB HD-Max is a high-quality Bluetooth speaker that's water resistant and can be paired with multiple speakers for a surround sound effect.

item.title: FCC changes how emergency alerts appear on your phone
item.description: The FCC is changing how you'll get emergency warnings — your phone will soon show 'National Alerts' that include FEMA warnings.

item.title: Bungie begins selling its official Destiny toaster
item.description: Bungie has made an official Destiny toaster that you can pre-order right now.

item.title: Google's new sleep-tracking Nest Hub is on sale for $80 right now
item.description: Save 20 percent on Google's second-generation Nest Hub smart display at B&H Photo.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Windows 11's surprise leak and the best of E3
item.description: We dive into what makes the Windows 11 leak so interesting.

item.title: The Morning After: Sony wants PS5 software beta testers
item.description: Today’s headlines: Sony announces PS5 beta program ahead of 'major' system update, Microsoft appoints CEO Satya Nadella as chairman, and all future Disney+ original series will be released on a Wednesday.

item.title: Apple's new 12.9-inch iPad Pro with 256GB storage is $100 off at Amazon
item.description: Apple's latest iPad Pro with a 12.9-inch screen and 256GB storage is on offer for $100 less at Amazon.
